questions.question: Which of the following is considered one of the most secure instruments for international trade?
Open account transactions are typically considered the highest risk for exporters.
Consignment in international trade is a variation of open account where payment is sent to the exporter only after ____.

answers.answer: the goods are sold by the foreign distributor to the end customer

questions.question: Which document typically involves the importer paying the face amount at sight?
Cash-in-Advance eliminates credit risk for the exporter.
A ____ is a commitment by a bank that payment will be made to the exporter if the terms are met.
What type of LC allows further transfer of payment to another supplier in the supply chain?
A Confirmed LC offers a guarantee of payment from a second bank to the seller.
A ____ payment method involves the buyer completing full payment before the goods are shipped.
Explain why Letters of Credit are considered highly secure for international trade transactions.

answers.answer: Letters of Credit are considered highly secure because they involve a commitment from a bank to pay the exporter, provided that all specified terms and conditions are met and verified through the presentation of required documents, thus reducing the risk of non-payment for both parties.
